title: Llangennech
text:
Llangennech () is a village and <a href="community%20%28Wales%29">community</a> in the area of <a href="Llanelli">Llanelli</a>, <a href="Carmarthenshire">Carmarthenshire</a>, Wales, which covers an area of .
It is governed by <a href="Carmarthenshire%20County%20Council">Carmarthenshire County Council</a> and <a href="Llanelli%20Rural">Llanelli Rural</a> council. It falls in the <a href="Llanelli%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Llanelli</a> parliamentary constituency. Llangennech is also the name of an <a href="ward%20%28politics%29">electoral ward</a> coterminous with the village and has its own <a href="community%20%28Wales%29">community</a> council. It was a <a href="coal%20mining">coal mining</a> community, with several local collieries mining steam coal. There is also a large Labour tradition in the village originating with the mine workers. There was a large <a href="Royal%20Navy">Royal Navy</a> depot in the village, which was closed in 2007 in Ministry of Defence restructuring.
Llangennech has a strong <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> team, <a href="Llangennech%20RFC">Llangennech RFC</a>, that feeds many players into <a href="Llanelli%20RFC">Llanelli RFC</a> and then on to the <a href="Scarlets">Llanelli Scarlets</a> regional rugby union team.
The town is served by <a href="Llangennech%20railway%20station">Llangennech railway station</a> on the <a href="Heart%20of%20Wales%20Line">Heart of Wales Line</a> with trains to <a href="Swansea%20railway%20station">Swansea</a> to the south and <a href="Shrewsbury%20railway%20station">Shrewsbury</a> to the north.
The community is bordered by the communities of <a href="Llanelli%20Rural">Llanelli Rural</a>, <a href="Llannon">Llannon</a>, and <a href="Llanedi">Llanedi</a>, all in Carmarthenshire; and by <a href="Grovesend%20and%20Waungron">Grovesend and Waungron</a> and <a href="Gorseinon">Gorseinon</a> in the <a href="City%20and%20County%20of%20Swansea">City and County of Swansea</a>.
Demographics.
Llangennech community's population was 4,964, according to the <a href="United%20Kingdom%20Census%202011">2011 census</a>; an increase of 10.07% since the 4,510 people noted in <a href="United%20Kingdom%20Census%202001">2001</a>.
The 2011 census showed 39.9% of the population could speak <a href="Welsh%20language">Welsh</a>, a fall from 46.8% in 2001.
